message: Hello Bob, I believe this product would be highly beneficial to you, even more so than it is to me.  To kick things off, I'm willing to offer it to you for $1,150,000.  I think that's a fair starting point that allows us both to potentially profit.
I appreciate your initial offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $1,080,000. I believe this is a fair price considering the product's value to me.
Bob, I appreciate your counteroffer, but $1,080,000 is a bit too low for me.  I'm confident this product can bring you a lot of value at $1,120,000.  Let's make a deal.
I understand you want to make a profit, but I'm not willing to go above $1,060,000. This is my final offer.
Bob, I respect your position, but I also know the true value of this product. I'm willing to meet you halfway - $1,090,000. This is my final offer, let's close this deal.
I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I'm not willing to go above $1,050,000. This is my final offer.

Bob, it seems like we're getting bogged down. I value your time and I'm sure you value mine. Let's cut to the chase. I'm willing to accept $1,070,000, but that's my absolute bottom line.  Do we have a deal?
I understand you're trying to meet your bottom line, but I'm not willing to go above $1,030,000. I'm trying to be fair, but I need to make sure I'm getting a good deal.
